speaker: NURSE
text: Hello, I'm Nurse Sarah. I see we have some initial information about you, but I'll need to ask a few more questions to get a clearer picture of your condition. What brings you in today?

speaker: PATIENT
text: My sister said I was turnin' yellow. My eyes look like piss. And this damn itching. It feels like ants are crawl-in' under my skin. Can you give me something for that itch? It's drivin' me nuts.

highlight.text: ants are crawl-in' under my skin

speaker: NURSE
text: That sounds very uncomfortable, I'm sorry you're experiencing that. Have you noticed any changes in your urine or stool color?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Yeah, the urine's dark, like Coke. And the stool this mornin' was like... pale. Like clay.

highlight.text: stool this mornin' was like... pale

speaker: NURSE
text: Thank you for telling me that. Can you describe the itching more? Is it worse at certain times of day, or on certain parts of your body?

speaker: PATIENT
text: It's just... everywhere. All the time. Sometimes it's on my arms, other times my chest. It was really bad last night, made it hard to sleep. Feels like my skin is raw underneath.

highlight.text: intense itching described as 'ants under skin'

speaker: NURSE
text: I understand. Have you experienced any abdominal pain, especially in the upper right side?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Yeah, kinda. It's not really sharp or anything, just a dull heavy feelin' under my ribs down there on the right side. Been there a little while.

highlight.text: dull heavy feelin' under my ribs down there on the right side

speaker: NURSE
text: Okay. Have you experienced any nausea, vomiting, or loss of appetite?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Yeah, I haven't been feelin' real hungry lately. Had a little nausea now and then, but haven't thrown up.

highlight.text: haven't been feelin' real hungry lately
Had a little nausea now and then

speaker: NURSE
text: Thank you. Are you currently taking any medications?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Yeah, just that lisinopril for my blood pressure. I was takin' some Tylenol for a toothache, but I stopped that yesterday.

speaker: NURSE
text: Alright. Have you had any fevers or chills?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, don't think so. No fevers I noticed.

speaker: NURSE
text: Okay. Can you describe the Tylenol use more specifically? How much and how often were you taking it?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Well, my tooth was really killin' me. I was takin' like, six to eight pills a day, for about the last three weeks. Just tryin' to deal with the pain.

highlight.text: my tooth was really killin' me
six to eight pills a day

speaker: NURSE
text: I understand the pain must have been really bad. Have you experienced any unintentional weight loss recently?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, haven't really weighed myself, but my clothes feel a little loose. Must be from not eatin' as much with the nausea.

speaker: NURSE
text: Okay. Have you traveled recently or been exposed to anyone with similar symptoms?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, been stayin' close to home. And nope, no one else is sick around me. Just me.

speaker: NURSE
text: Okay. Have you noticed any changes in your bowel habits besides the color, such as diarrhea or constipation?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, just the color of the stool. No real diarrhea or gettin' stopped up.

highlight.text: just the color of the stool

speaker: NURSE
text: Understood. Can you describe the intensity of the itching on a scale of 1 to 10?

speaker: PATIENT
text: It's bad. Like, a good eight or nine most of the time. Sometimes worse if I think about it. Makes it hard to focus or even sleep.

speaker: NURSE
text: That does sound very intense. Do you have any drug allergies?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, no allergies to meds that I know of.

speaker: NURSE
text: Okay. Have you had any fevers or chills, especially with the itching or abdominal discomfort?

speaker: PATIENT
text: Nah, don't think so. Haven't felt feverish or had any chills. Just this itch and the yellow.

speaker: NURSE
text: Understood. Have you consumed alcohol recently, and if so, how much?

speaker: PATIENT
text: I have a few beers with the guys, nothin' crazy.

highlight.text: a few beers with the guys

speaker: NURSE
text: Thank you. Based on what you've told me, we need to do some further tests to better understand your condition. The doctor will be seeing you shortly.

speaker: PATIENT
text: Alright. Can you at least give me somethin' for this itch though? It's drivin' me crazy.
